oai_dc:dc.dc:title: APPLICABILITY OF A NEW HYBRID PARAMETRIC WAVE PREDICTION MODEL
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hatada, Yoshio
Yamaguchi, Masataka
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: prediction model
wave prediction
parametric model
model application
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: DOLPHIN-I is a new hybrid parametric deep water wave prediction model developed by the authors. This paper examines the applicability of DOLPHIN-I, on the basis of the comparison of the computation with the data of significant waves obtained in five sea areas with different horizontal scales around Japan during monsoons and typhoons. In particular, the wave data in Osaka Bay includes frequency and directional spectra. It is verified that the model practicality is excellent, because it reproduces well the wave data observed in any concerned sea area.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 22 (1990): Proceedings of 22nd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Delft, The Netherlands, 1990.
